item.title: The Welcome Page
item.dc:creator: smaadjahangir
item.content:encoded:
Ok so finally i am starting my blog. I will be posting the issues and solutions that i have faced or will face as a System Administrator and hope this will help others in findings the solution. Currently I am working on Linux (Debian), Apache, Nginx, Varnish, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Various AWS products, OpenSource applications ( Wordpress Magento ) etc
Feel free to comment on my blogs.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: smaadjahangir
item.content:encoded: Currently Working as a System Administrator and developing my skills with time. Currently I am working on Linux (Debian), Apache, Nginx, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Various AWS products, OpenSource applications ( WordPress Magento ) etc Feel free to comment on my blogs or contact me.

item.title: PostgreSQL useful commands
item.dc:creator: smaadjahangir
item.content:encoded: So i was working on PostgreSQL and collected few commands for assistance in future. This is basic commands that can help MySQL user to get started. PostgreSQL is accessible by only postgres user (by default) so you have to use sudo with every command executing from root user.   Entering PSQL prompt/Command line : sudo -u postgres psql   Get a list of databases in Postgres: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres psql -l From PSQL prompt : \l [Note: This is backslash followed by lower-case L]   Create a Database in PostgreSQL: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres createdb testdb From PSQL prompt : CREATE DATABASE testdb   Delete/Drop a Database in PostgreSQL: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres dropdb testdb From PSQL prompt : DROP DATABASE testdb   Backup/Dump a Database in PostgreSQL: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres pg_dump testdb > backup.out   Restore a Database in PostgreSQL: From Shell Prompt : sudo -u postgres psql -f backup.out testdb   Other usefull command from PSQL prompt: Selecting Database : \c testdb Getting List of tables : \d OR \dt Exiting PSQL prompt : \q Getting Help : \? OR \h OR \h CREATE   Hope this will help.

item.title: Delete SSL certificates from Amazon account
item.dc:creator: smaadjahangir
item.content:encoded:
I was working on AWS ELB's and faced issue when uploading SSL certificate on ELB. Found out that by default AWS ELB can only hold 10 SSL certificates and if you exceed this value, It will throw an quota exceed error. So i have to delete few of the old to ones to continue. You cannot delete amazon SSL certificates through GUI. Amazon API tools is required for this task. Download the IAMCli utilities from amazon and untar it in /root

export AWS_IAM_HOME=/root/IAMCli-1.2.0/

List the available SSL certificates in the account. (If you get Java Error then export Java Home path too)

# /root/IAMCli-1.2.0/bin/iam-servercertlistbypath  –aws-credential-file  /root/my-account-creds.txt arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/answerable-com-lb-ssl-cert arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/cdn-olokiran-certif arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/cert arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/dsp-olokiran-com-cert arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/ostk-kik

Delete the unwanted certificate using the following command

/root/IAMCli-1.2.0/bin/iam-servercertdel –aws-credential-file my-account-creds.txt  -s dsp-olokiran-com-cert

where

# cat /root/my-account-creds.txt AWSAccessKeyId=XXXXXXXXX AWSSecretKey=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

item.title: PostgreSQL for MySQL users
item.dc:creator: smaadjahangir
item.content:encoded: So i was working on PostgreSQL and collected few commands for assistance in future. This is basic commands that can help MySQL user to get started. PostgreSQL is accessible by only postgres user (by default) so you have to use sudo with every command executing from root user.   Entering PSQL prompt/Command line : sudo -u postgres psql   Get a list of databases in Postgres: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres psql -l From PSQL prompt : \l [Note: This is backslash followed by lower-case L]   Create a Database in PostgreSQL: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres createdb testdb From PSQL prompt : CREATE DATABASE testdb   Delete/Drop a Database in PostgreSQL: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres dropdb testdb From PSQL prompt : DROP DATABASE testdb   Backup/Dump a Database in PostgreSQL: From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres pg_dump testdb > backup.out   Restore a Database in PostgreSQL: From Shell Prompt : sudo -u postgres psql -f backup.out testdb   Other usefull command from PSQL prompt: Selecting Database : \c testdb Getting List of tables : \d OR \dt Exiting PSQL prompt : \q Getting Help : \? OR \h OR \h CREATE   Hope this will help.

SYED MAAD JAHANGIR

Permanent Address Contact Information

306 Shamim Tower and Shopping Mall, E-mail: smaadjahangir@gmail.com

Block 8 F.B.Area D.O.B: March 14, 1987

Karachi, Cell: 03453022296

Pakistan

Experience

Cloudways – Gaditek Associates

Junior System Administrator May 2012 - Present

  • Installation, configuration & administration of Linux Servers , Maintain and Manage various services running in Linux system such as Apache, Nginx, HAProxy, MySQL, Shorewall, Varnish, OpenVPN, Postfix, etc.
  • Setup and maintain Samba and NFS servers as corporate client’s backup servers.
  • Creating bash scripts to automate various tasks.
  • Deployment and maintenance of Cloudways corporate customer’s services and servers on Amazon Web Service, Linode, CloudSigma and ElasticHosts.
  • Working on different products of AWS. EC2, VPC, ELB, RDS, Route53, Cloudfront, S3 etc.
  • Installation, configuration, maintain and monitoring the availability of the network and services using Zabbix
  • Installation and troubleshooting of Open source Application like Magento, Wordpress, Drupal, Joomla etc.
  • Working on backups using Rsnapshot and Duplicity.
  • Writing and maintaining documentation for multiple tasks and procedures.
  • Currently working on Ruby, MCollective and Sensu with Graphite.

eWorld (Pvt.) Ltd.

Junior Network Engineer August 2008 - Dec 2009

  • Maintain and monitor Mail Services, Web Services and DNS Services.
  • Maintain and monitor Network Infrastructure.
  • Take measures to enhance network availability.
  • Installing and configuring new hardware and software.
  • Implement and document Network Changes and configurations.
  • IP address management.
  • Plan and implement monitoring and backup routine of NOC devices, configurations and Logs.
  • Training of Technical Support Staff.
  • Interaction with vendors and other service providers.

Education

PIMSAT Pakistan

BS – Bachelors of Science (Information Technology) Graduated 2011



Personal Profile and Skills

- Looking to build on my extensive range of technical, communication, competitive and professional skills within a suitably challenging role. Keen to achieve further professional development.
